data.question: What is the title of the research article?
data.answer: Stimuli-Modulated Metal Oxidation States in Photochromic MOFs

data.question: Who is the corresponding author of the article?
What is the main focus of the research conducted in the article?
data.answer: The research focuses on reversible modulation of metal oxidation states in metalâ€“organic frameworks (MOFs) through integration of photochromic moieties as a function of an excitation wavelength.

data.question: What method was used for X-ray intensity data collection?
data.answer: A Bruker D8 QUEST diffractometer equipped with a PHOTON-II area detector and an Incoatec microfocus source was used for X-ray intensity data collection.

data.question: What is the quantum yield of photoisomerization for Aberchrome 670 in thin films as reported in the article?
data.answer: The photoisomerization quantum yield of Aberchrome 670 in thin films is reported as 27%.

data.question: How was the crystallinity of Cu(BCMTC)(MeOH) confirmed?
data.answer: The crystallinity of Cu(BCMTC)(MeOH) was confirmed by powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD).

data.question: What was the purpose of using a charge neutralizer in X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) studies?
data.answer: A charge neutralizer was used to compensate for sample charging by bombarding the sample with low-energy electrons, a strategy applied for insulating copper-containing MOFs.

data.question: What was the transmetallation percentage determined by ICP-MS for Cu1.9Zn0.1(TNDS)(DBTD)?
data.answer: A transmetallation of 93% was determined by ICP-MS for Cu1.9Zn0.1(TNDS)(DBTD).

data.question: True or False: The article reports the first determination of photoisomerization quantum yields for photochromic moieties within a MOF matrix.
What was the observed effect of complete reduction of Cu(II) on the EPR signal in Cu2.0(BPMTC)(DBTD) after treatment with hydrazine?
data.answer: Complete signal reduction was observed, suggesting the reduction of Cu(II) to Cu(I).
